New York University Archives
New York University Archives Collection of School of Engineering Technical Reports
New York University. University Archives
MC.326
.5 linear feet in 1 manuscript box
1959-1979 Materials are in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access. The New York University Tandon School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute. In 2014, the programs merged with New York University to become the second oldest private engineering and technology school in the United States. This collection consists of technical reports produced by the New York University School of Engineering from 1959-1979.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of technical reports produced by the New York University School of Engineering from 1959-1979.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Transferred by Carol Hutchins in May 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.054.
Custodial History
Items were weeded from collections at other academic institutions and transferred to New York University.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of School of Engineering Technical Reports; MC 326; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level.
Historical Note
The New York University Tandon School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute. In 2014, the programs merged with New York University to become the second oldest private engineering and technology school in the United States.
Engineering -- Study and teaching Engineering -- History Technical reports New York University. School of Engineering and Science New York University. Polytechnic School of Engineering
